messages: 26bc06ef20140a18e87d39694369f23e (15:53): may I use fields that span multiple rows?
26bc06ef20140a18e87d39694369f23e (15:54): i.e. <table><form><td><input></td><td><input></td></form></table>?
26bc06ef20140a18e87d39694369f23e (15:54): I have to align table headers with multiple entries
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (15:55): mch03820: Tables can be contained by forms. Table cells can contain forms. Forms cannot contain bits of tables.
26bc06ef20140a18e87d39694369f23e (15:55): Dorward, so how can I align the headers with the form elements?
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (15:56): mch03820: Err. No idea. Depends on the data.
26bc06ef20140a18e87d39694369f23e (15:56): pardon? "Depends on the data"?
26bc06ef20140a18e87d39694369f23e (15:57): each row should contain one form, consisting of two text inputs and one submit button
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (15:57): Yes. I don't know what data you need to send the the server and when. So I don't know how it can be organised in a way that can be represented by HTML.
26bc06ef20140a18e87d39694369f23e (15:57): the data will be POSTed to a perl script
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (15:57): mch03820: Have one form. Use the value of the submit button to determine which inputs get looked at.

26bc06ef20140a18e87d39694369f23e (16:00): Dorward, the problem is that I'd like to use a wrapper script that will call the actual perl script taking the POSTed data. Can I pass the original referrer down to the second perl script?
26bc06ef20140a18e87d39694369f23e (16:01): maybe I should just pass it as an additional query string
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (16:01): mch03820: So in response to an HTTP request you run a Perl script that generates its own HTTP request?
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (16:01): mch03820: You should be able to specify the referer with LWP.

8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (16:16): mch03820: Then you're stuck either abandoning support for IE or writing more complex code that can process based on the name of the successful submit instead of the value.
26bc06ef20140a18e87d39694369f23e (16:16): what's wrong with IE?
26bc06ef20140a18e87d39694369f23e (16:17): is this code on the client-sided or server-sided?
26bc06ef20140a18e87d39694369f23e (16:18): the question is whether my server can tell me which submit input was used to submit the form. I don't care whether I identify it by name or somehow else.
26bc06ef20140a18e87d39694369f23e (16:19): but I suppose all names (unique per submit button) are present, because they are part of the form, right?
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (16:21): mch03820: IE doesn't support <button type="submit" name="foo" value="bar">Baz</button>. It treats it as if it has value="Baz".
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (16:21): mch03820: Only the clicked submit button is successful.
